meanings.sent1: The filterability of the coffee grounds made it easy to separate them from the liquid.
meanings.sent2: The filterability of the water allowed the small particles to be removed effectively.
meanings.sent3: The filterability of the sieve was so good that not even a single grain of sand could escape!
meanings.sent4: Her filterability in choosing the right words for the poem was like a skilled artist selecting the perfect brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The filterability of the air in the room was so poor that even the faintest smell lingered for hours.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to pass through a filter.
meanings.sent1: The filterability of the oil was crucial for the success of the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The filterability of the fabric determined its suitability for use in the water filtration system.
meanings.sent3: The filterability of the sieve was so high that it seemed to have a magical power to strain out impurities.
meanings.sent4: The filterability of her ideas through the editorial process was like refining gold from ore.
meanings.sent5: The filterability of the sunlight through the leaves created a beautiful pattern on the ground.
